question: 込む
userAnswer:
<tag title="after masu stem">suff:</tag>{go-into | become-completely | do-thoroughly}
to-be: {complex/intricate | crowded/packed<tag>(usu:<ja>混む</ja>)</tag>}
activeAnswer:
<tag title="after masu stem">suff:</tag>{go-into | become-completely | do-thoroughly}
to-be: {complex/intricate | crowded/packed<tag>(usu:<ja>混む</ja>)</tag>}
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>crowded</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to be crowded</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Lucky for you, the reading you learned with the kanji is the one you use here.
